data.title: Very nice venue
data.text: Living in K'ville I have been here for quite a few different events.  Their staff is always friendly and helpful.  It's a great venue for anything.  With the ability to cut the room to a smaller size or open it up for a huge affair.

data.title: Went to festival of trees
data.text: great set up. People were very friendly and helpful. Was decorated wonderfully. Went for 2 days there was so much to see!! Recommend this event

data.title: nice place for conventions
data.text: i have attended conventions and weddings here.  It is a great place for conventions (parking is sometimes hard to find) but not a great place for weddings.

data.title: Not very well laid out and not many parking options
data.text: This building has a strange lay-out and it seems like there's always that "where do I go?" moment.  Not much parking nearby.  The best option is to park at the Holiday Inn across the street but it fills up FAST.  My advice is to arrive early!

data.title: Conference planner review
data.text: The convention center has the typical, flexible space of a downtown convention center. It has carpeted ballrooms & meeting rooms as well as large concrete floor display spaces for lots of different venues. Great staff, works very well with clients. There are many downtown hotels, but only a few within walking distance, and the ones in walking distance are 3 star at best. A new hotel called the Tennessean will be opening in 2017, but it doesn't look to be a large hotel- guessing maybe 200 rooms or so. We used our space for a church convention in June. Did a lot of walking & older participants had issues from long walks & heat since no enclosed walkways.

data.title: Great venue
data.text: I've been to several different things at this convention center, and it's always nice and clean. There are people working there that are helpful, courteous, giving directions, etc. Parking is convenient.

data.title: When you gotta go...
data.text: The facilities themselves are small compared to other larger city convention centers.  With that said, the grounds are well maintained, parking not so bad, and security is good.  We go herre every year for a Christmas festival and the Dinosaur show...which will be wrapping up next year cause my youngest doesn't want to go again...haha.

data.title: Parking is not so great
data.text: Maybe I just don't know where to park, but it is always a hike and you have to pay to park.  That being said, the venue is perfect, and anything I have attended there has always been set up great.

data.title: Easy Access & very walkable.
data.text: Nice convention center in the middle of downtown. Easy access from the freeway. Handicap parking near entrance. Large enough for a decent size event. Some convention centers are so gigantic and difficult to get around, not this one. Nice & cool in the summer, clean restrooms. Visited for several different events and competitions.

data.title: Fanboy Expo at the Conventionn Center
data.text:
This weekend was one of the best for Fanboy! I'm very glad they use the Knoxville Convention Center for this event. It's probably the only place around town that is large enough to accommodate such a large number of people! 

The only thing I would like to comment on is the air conditioning system on the convention floor. It was somewhat stuffy and just a little bit warm. Maybe a fan system with more "oomph"? Otherwise, the convention center is beautiful. The restrooms are always maintained very well by the staff. The cell phone charging stations is a wonderful addition! I'm sure it's very helpful when needed!  I also love that you can walk right outside and see the Sunsphere & the water nearby. :)

data.title: Beautiful venue!
data.text: I have been to several conventions here.  The views are great if you want to take a break.  Plus it is next to the World's Fair Park which has some nice walkways.

data.title: Nationals
data.text: Very good facility, was pleased to have chairs versus bleachers to sit on. The landscaping & interior are very nice compared to a lot of venues we have been to. Location is good, though parking is difficult.

data.title: center
data.text: Well laid out.  We could walk all around and see many sites.  Bathrooms available and clearly marked.  Wide isles for movement.

data.title: Going in style
data.text: Former Chairman of the Board retirement party was first class and KCC was a great venue.  Plenty of space, pleasant staff and great food (tasty and hot).

data.title: Close to everything
data.text: Mid sized convention center close to the world's fair park and major national chain hotels like the Holiday in (closest) Marriott and Crown Plaza. Pretty good and modern for this historic mid sized town.

data.title: Typical Convention Center
data.text: This is your typical convention center in the middle of downtown Knoxville. I've been part of many activities here without incident including my high school graduation.

data.title: Great venue, easy access
data.text: My husbands business brought us to the area with an event primarily held at the convention center. Happy with the venue,  seemed up to par with the best!

data.title: Nice!!
data.text: Easily found free parking within walking distance. Very clean and well organized inside.Vendors were reasonable, enjoyed my meetings there!!

data.title: Came for ozone gymnastics meet
data.text:
We where at kcc for ozone gymnastics meet in the exbit hall with is the kcc bacement if you dint know that areready so know if it says the exbit hall you go down escalators and you are there so first off the wifi is powerd by show nets so it is paid internet and so here are the speeds and prices available at the knoxville convention center

And last a hourley opption

The smokey mountion cafe is pepsi like the whole convention center 
Look at my pics

data.title: Clean and Great Set Up!
data.text: Love the art work displayed throughout with a unique variety! Great set up! Have attended a conference in the past but this time we just passed through to look at the art on display!
